action: I want to accurately register and update product inventory levels
reason: Because incorrect inventory information leads to shipment delays and sales losses
acceptance_criteria: The system shall allow only authenticated users with 'Inventory Management' privileges to execute inventory operations.
The system must validate that the provided Product ID exists in the Product Master table.
The system must validate that the provided Warehouse ID exists in the Warehouse Master table.
The system shall manage inventory records based on a unique combination of Product ID and Warehouse ID.
The system must enforce that Inventory Quantity is a non-negative integer.
The system shall implement optimistic locking to detect and prevent concurrent update conflicts.
The system must execute inventory updates within a single database transaction to ensure atomicity.
The system shall maintain a complete history of inventory changes, recording User ID, pre-update quantity, post-update quantity, and reason code.
The system must support CSV bulk updates, skipping invalid rows and logging specific errors for those rows.
The system shall apply consistent validation logic for both API requests and CSV imports.
The system must use parameterized queries for all database interactions to prevent SQL injection.
The system shall sanitize all input values to protect against Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks.
The system must publish a notification event upon successful inventory updates.
The system shall target an API response time of under 500ms for update operations.
The system must enforce rate limiting on the API to prevent abuse.
The system shall return generic error messages and must not expose internal database structures in API responses.
The system must transmit all operation logs to the centralized audit log infrastructure.
The system shall include inventory data in the daily backup schedule.
The API must adhere to REST architectural principles and support versioning.
The system shall restrict update operations to PUT or PATCH HTTP methods.
The system must return an HTTP 403 Forbidden status for unauthorized access attempts.
The system shall support logical deletion only and restrict data restoration operations to users with 'Administrator' privileges.
